hero.title: Explore Rishikesh Like a Local
hero.subtitle: Spiritual vibes, nature escapes & scooty freedom
hero.description: Rishikesh is not just about rafting and temples. Discover hidden waterfalls, peaceful ghats, scenic mountain roads and cafés — best explored on a scooty.

whyScooty.title: Why Explore Rishikesh on a Scooty?
points: Easy access to hill roads & waterfalls

places.name: Triveni Ghat
places.description: The most sacred ghat in Rishikesh, located at the confluence of the Ganga, Yamuna and Saraswati rivers. Famous for its soulful evening Ganga Aarti.
places.tips: Reach at least 30 minutes early for a good spot during Aarti.

places.name: Parmarth Niketan Ashram
places.description: One of the largest and most renowned ashrams in Rishikesh, known for yoga, meditation programs and its peaceful riverside Ganga Aarti.
places.tips: Wear modest clothes and maintain silence inside the ashram.

places.name: Beatles Ashram (Chaurasi Kutia)
places.description: A historic meditation complex where The Beatles stayed in 1968. Known for meditation domes, graffiti art and spiritual calm inside the forest.
places.tips: Carry water and wear comfortable shoes; entry ticket required.

places.name: Lakshman Jhula
places.description: An iconic suspension bridge believed to be the place where Lakshman crossed the Ganga using jute ropes. Surrounded by temples, shops and cafés.
places.tips: Avoid peak afternoon hours due to heavy crowd.

places.name: Ram Jhula
places.description: A suspension bridge connecting Sivananda Ashram to Swarg Ashram. A peaceful spiritual stretch with temples, ashrams and river views.
places.tips: Best explored early morning for calm vibes.

places.name: Neelkanth Mahadev Temple
places.description: A sacred Shiva temple located in the forested hills above Rishikesh. According to mythology, Lord Shiva drank poison here during Samudra Manthan.
places.tips: Road is scenic but narrow; ride carefully on scooty.

places.name: Janki Setu
places.description: A newly constructed pedestrian suspension bridge connecting Tapovan to Swarg Ashram. Offers stunning river views and smoother walking experience.
places.tips: Great alternative to Lakshman Jhula for peaceful walks.

places.name: Bajrang Setu
places.description: A modern suspension bridge connecting key spiritual zones of Rishikesh, designed to reduce crowd pressure on older bridges.
places.tips: Best experienced during sunset for photos.

places.name: Neer Garh Waterfall
places.description: One of the most popular waterfalls near Rishikesh. A short uphill trek leads to multiple cascading pools surrounded by lush greenery.
places.tips: Wear good trekking shoes and avoid weekends for less crowd.

places.name: Kyarki View Point
places.description: A peaceful hilltop viewpoint offering panoramic views of the Ganga valley, forested mountains, and winding hill roads. One of the best hidden scooty ride destinations near Rishikesh.
places.tips: Road is narrow but scenic; ideal for scooty rides. Carry water and avoid riding after dark.

places.name: Patna Waterfall
places.description: A peaceful and less crowded waterfall located near Patna village. Ideal for travelers looking for calm nature and photography.
places.tips: Avoid visiting during heavy rainfall season.

places.name: Phool Chatti Waterfall
places.description: A hidden gem waterfall near Phool Chatti Ashram. Surrounded by forest trails and natural rock formations.
places.tips: Best visited early; limited food stalls nearby.

places.name: Shivpuri
places.description: A scenic riverside destination known for white water rafting camps, forest surroundings, and sunset river views.
places.tips: Great stop while riding towards Devprayag road.

places.name: Marine Drive Viewpoint
places.description: A picturesque stretch along the Ganga offering mountain views, calm riverbanks, and scenic cycling & scooty rides.
places.tips: Carry water; limited shops on the route.

places.name: Kaudiyala
places.description: A serene hill-side location famous for extreme rafting stretches, jungle views and peaceful river surroundings.
places.tips: Best for experienced riders; roads are curvy.

places.name: Ganga Beach (Secret Beaches)
places.description: Hidden sandy riverbanks along the Ganga, perfect for relaxing, picnics, and peaceful sunset moments.
places.tips: Avoid swimming; currents can be strong.

places.name: Ganga View Cafes (Lakshman Jhula)
places.description: Popular rooftop cafes offering uninterrupted views of River Ganga. Ideal for relaxing breakfasts, peaceful evenings, and solo travel vibes.
places.tips: Visit early morning for quiet ambience; evenings get crowded.

places.name: Beatles Café (Little Buddha Café)
places.description: One of the most iconic cafes in Rishikesh, inspired by The Beatles. Known for international cuisine, chilled music, and river-facing seating.
places.tips: Best tables are riverside—wait if needed.

places.name: Freedom Café
places.description: A peaceful café with yoga-friendly vibes, perfect for digital nomads and travelers seeking calm food spots with spiritual surroundings.
places.tips: Try their herbal teas and breakfast bowls.

places.name: Shambala Café
places.description: Hidden riverside café with low seating, perfect for sunset watching and relaxed conversations near the flowing Ganga.
places.tips: Scooty parking nearby; walk last few meters.

places.name: Sunset Point Cafes (Tapovan)
places.description: A cluster of small cafés facing west, offering stunning sunset views over the river and mountains.
places.tips: Reach 30 minutes before sunset for best seats.
